p: The target data source is a time series in which distinct epidemics (seasons) can be identified and extracted. In our case, the target is ILINet or one of the other influenza-related time series listed above. Each predictor data source is a historical time series that can be aligned with the target. When forecasting a season, we assume that all predictor data sources can only be observed for the first w weeks of the season, and then make n week long forecasts beginning with the w + 1st week of the season. The target data source is assumed to be unobserved for the focal season, unless it is also serving as a predictor.
